transcript: the colors the lights the toys and all the unexpected things i find every time i go like watermelon with straw antennas or puppies with mohawks i also liked to make environments for people to explore and play i would take plastic sheets plastic bags and things i would find in the hardware store or around the house pump it through plastic tubing creating these i also liked to make devices that work with body parts i would take camera led lights and a bungee cord and strap it on my waist and i would and see what it does and then i would videotape my eye and using the dark part of my eye tricking the sensor into thinking it 's night some lightbulbs and television sets it would be easier for other people to wear the helmet this device allows me to symbolically extract other people 's each eye is controlling a different device this eye is inflating a plastic tube and these two eyes are activating glowing water i love science and biology in two thousand and seven i was doing a research fellowship at the smithsonian natural history museum looking at bioluminous organisms in the oean this research inspired my work in many different ways things like movement or different light patterns so i started gathering a lot of different types of material in my studio and just experimenting and trying this out trying that out and seeing what types of creatures i can come up with i used a lot of computer cooling fans this is an 8 000 square foot installation composed of many different creatures some hanging from the ceiling and some resting on the floor from afar they look alien like but when you look closer they 're all made out of black garbage bags or tupperware containers
